Description.val:
Underwater Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) program supplies EOD and Maritime Expeditionary forces with the necessary allowance outfitting, and diving and diving-related equipment aligned to fulfill assigned missions that includes Expeditionary Mine Countermeasures (ExMCM), other Maritime Expeditionary missions, and Marine Mammal Systems (MMS) operations. Most equipment must have inherently low acoustic and magnetic signatures to support maritime operations in the vicinity of influence fired ordnance.  This funding supports outfitting the Navy's only comprehensive capability in the fleet that can conduct full spectrum detect-to-engage expeditionary MCM missions. Specifically, the Underwater Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) program supports EOD Groups, Units, and Detachments worldwide as well as Mobile Diving and Salvage Units (MDSUs) across the globe.

The establishment of ExMCM Forces under the direction of Commander, US Fleet Forces Command has resulted in an increased inventory requirement for Underwater EOD systems and equipment, with a resultant requirement for re-aligned procurement and fielding priorities. The nature of the missions assigned to EOD and MCM forces under OPNAVINST 3501.97H, Required Operational Capabilities & Projected Operational Environments (ROC/POE), require an aggregated set of systems and equipment to perform the wide range of mine countermeasures, underwater detection, location, investigation, force protection, and neutralization tasks that comprise the mission set. The requirements for the procurement of each of these system suites are articulated in OPNAV approved requirements documents in accordance with DoD Directive 5000.2, SECNAVINST 5000.2E, and the JCIDS process as defined by CJSCINST 3170.01 and defined by the JROC approved ExMCM ICD.

Naval Special Warfare (NSW) - FY 2020 continues procurement of a service-common systems program for Naval Special Warfare's (NSW) Unmanned Undersea Vehicles (UUVs). NSW currently employs UUVs as an intelligence collection platform, building situational awareness of the Undersea Domain, and prior to conducting clandestine operations in support of the highest strategic objectives. UUVs are critical to NSW's undersea component, mission planning for anti-access and area denial (A2AD) environments, and the current fight against violent extremist organizations.  The use of open architecture, untethered platforms not only buys down risk to mission and force, but also provides the operational commander a diversified menu of employment options.

Justification.val:
FY 2020 funding is required to continue procurement and fielding of Underwater EOD program systems and equipment to outfit Expeditionary MCM Companies, EOD and Mobile Salvage units with advanced sensors and hardware required to accomplish their OPNAV approved Required Operational Capability and Projected Operational Environments. This equipment will allow warfighters to detect, locate, investigate, neutralize and render safe unexploded ordnance including improvised explosive devices. 

Additionally, FY 2020 funding is required to procure product improvements needed for systems designed and first produced over 40 years ago, as well as the production engineering and integrated logistics support needed for all Expeditionary MCM Companies, EOD Units, and Expeditionary Salvage units. These systems provide the only expeditionary mine interdiction capability in the US Navy.  If these forces are not properly outfitted lives may be lost, access to sea lanes of communication could be severed, and risk to transiting forces will be elevated.   Specifically, upgrade kits to MK 18 Family of Systems will be procured to provide increased MCM capability through procurement of the Mod 1 Block C upgrade kits; MOTS ROV enhancements will be procured to provide EOD Response capabilities for mine/unexploded ordinance (UXO) target prosecution; improved diver sensor tools will be procured to provide enhanced target detection and localization capabilities; and auxiliary equipment procured that is required to fully outfit systems to perform their intended missions.

OCO: 
Underwater EOD Programs - FY 2020 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) funding is for Operation Freedom Sentinel - In Theater (OFS-T) to procure 3 MK 18 Mod 2 vehicles in support of the C5F operations by ExMCM companies in theater.

Name.@footnote: CE 1.1.1 MIW-VIP: MIW-VIP measures magnetic and acoustic signatures using existing ranges and portable ranges (Forward Area Combined Degaussing and Acoustic Range (FACDAR)). Measurements are taken in both home port areas and deployment areas to assess susceptibility to various threat mines. Efforts across the FYDP include ranging RHIBS, newly acquired equipment (related OPNAV approved Table of Allowance items) and unmanned systems (i.e. MK 18 Mod's 1 & 2). FY2020 efforts will focus on ranging various system components and sub-systems to determine specific signature characteristics that will aid in development of tactics and procedures to ensure survivability of these systems in various operation conditions.

CE 2.1.1 MODIFIED OFF-THE-SHELF (MOTS) REMOTELY OPERATED VEHICLE (ROV): Provides for procurement funding for OPNAV approved fleet outfitting of a modified-off-the-shelf Remotely Operated Vehicle. This capability will significantly reduce operational risk to divers when investigation and interdiction of an underwater threat is required, i.e. sea mine or underwater Improved Explosive Device.

CE 2.1.2 UW DIVER INTEGRATION SENSORS: Provides for the procurement of a family of systems based on Modified-Off-The Shelf (MOTS), mature technologies and upgrades to Diver Integrated Sensors. Unit cost of individual retrofit kits may vary based on number and type of technology included in the kit.

CE 2.1.3 ADVANCED FIRING SYSTEMS: Provides for the procurement of improved transmitters and receivers to provide safe stand-off command detonation capabilities to Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD ) divers. The improved firing systems will address the current capability shortfalls of the legacy MK 12 Acoustic Firing System.
CE 2.1.4 INFLUENCE SIGNATURE REDUCTION: Funding procures reduction of acoustic, magnetic and seismic signatures for equipment used in a suspected minefield.

CE 3.1.1. UNDERWATER (UW) INTEGRATED SYSTEM INTERFACE: Outfitting of the upgrade of COIN (Common Operator Interface, Navy, a graphical user interface) to interoperate with the MK 18 Family of Systems and the advanced sensors. COIN upgrades resourced will ensure interoperability with legacy MCM assets and that the fielding of the advanced sensors will meet interoperability performance requirements.

Name.val: UQ036 - DIVER SAFETY LIFE SUPPORT EQUIPMENT

Name.@footnote: CE 4.1.1 DIVER SAFETY LIFE SUPPORT EQUIPMENT: Provides for the procurement of a family of systems based on MOTS and mature technologies to provide safer tools and life support systems for EOD UMCM and MDSU operations. Based on family of systems concept, unit cost of individual systems and sub-systems will vary based on number and type of technology included.

CE 5.1.1 MMS UMCM: Funding procures equipment needed to outfit MK 7 MMS detachments in support of Maritime Homeland Defense and contingency response MCM missions. MK 7 MMS remains the only operational buried mine hunting capability in the US Navy.

CE 5.1.2 MMS ALLOWANCE: Funding supports outfitting of tools/equipment for all Fleet MMS in accordance with CNO approved allowance list. MK 7 MMS provides the USN's only buried mine hunting capability.
CE 5.1.3 MEDICAL OUTFITTING: Provides funding to procure necessary medical equipment for Navy MMS in accordance with SECNAVINST 3900.41
CE 5.1.4 UW LOW MAGNETIC TEST EQUIPMENT UPGRADE: Upgrades existing equipment which measures acoustic, magnetic and seismic signatures for that equipment used in a suspected minefield.
Name.val: 5.1.4) UW LOW MAGNETIC TEST EQUIPM UPGRADE

Name.@footnote: CE 5.1.5 MMS LITTORAL PORT & HARBOR DEFENSE OPERATIONS: Funding procures equipment necessary for Fleet MMS to conduct port and harbor defense operations in support of USNORTHCOM Homeland Defense Contingency Response missions.
Name.val: 5.1.5) MMS LITTORAL PORT & HARBOR DEFENSE OPERATIONS

Name.@footnote: CE 6.1.1 MK 18 MOD 2 UUV (0204224N): Provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 Mod 1 and 2 vehicles, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet and Seventh Fleet areas of responsibility.

CE 6.1.2 MK 18 MOD 1 UMCM UUV INCREMENTAL (CIP) Retrofit Kit (0204224N): Unit cost of individual retrofit kits may vary based on the number and type of technologies included and systems being upgraded and are identified as incremental Block Upgrades (e.g., current increment Block C retrofit kit is an upgrade in capability for the Mk 18 Mod 1 UUV system). These retrofit kits address more than one upgrade and address different functional area, i.e. enhanced navigation, system autonomy, improved post mission analysis, etc. Accordingly the number of retrofit kits may exceed number of systems/vehicles fielded
Name.val: 6.1.2) MK 18 MOD 1 UMCM UUV INCREMENTAL (CIP) Retrofit Kit (0204224N)

Name.@footnote: CE 6.1.3 MK18 MOD2 RETROFIT KITS (SSAM) (0204224N): Provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 Mod 2 retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet and Seventh Fleet area of responsibility. These retrofit kits add advanced capability to the MK 18 Mod 2 system. Unit costs of the advanced sensor retrofit kits can vary based on the number and type of sensor upgrades.

CE 6.1.4 MK 18 Mod 2 Retrofit Kits (ATLAS forward look sonar) (0204224N): Provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 Mod 2 retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet and Seventh Fleet area of responsibility. These retrofit kits add advanced capability to the MK 18 Mod 2 system. Unit costs of the advanced sensor retrofit kits can vary based on the number and type of sensor upgrades.

CE 6.1.5 MK 18 MOD 2 RETROFIT KITS INCREMENT:(Autonomy and Automated Target Recognition): Provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 Mod 2 retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet and Seventh Fleet area of responsibility. These retrofit kits add advanced capability to the MK 18 Mod 2 system. Unit costs of the advanced sensor retrofit kits can vary based on the number and type of sensor upgrades.

CE 6.1.7 MK18 MOD2 UUV OCO RESET: Reset funding is for replacement of UUV significantly damaged during fleet operations in support of C5F missions. OCO resources will restore deployed systems to full operational readiness to meet C5F AoR mission needs.

CE 7.1 Production Engineering: Funding supports the increased production of MK 18,  MK 19 Family of Systems, and the Marine Mammals Systems (MMS)  requiring additional production support to include production contract award, first article tests, and factory acceptance tests.

CE 8.1 Product Improvement: Provides for engineering services to improve fielded MMS Systems/EOD Diver-based and unmanned systems to improve Human Systems Integration (HSI)/Logistics domains insert technology refresh and/or decrease costs.

CE 9.1 INITIAL TRAINING: Funding provides resources needed due to the increase in training requirements due to expanded employment of fleet systems (i.e. mainly MK 18, Mk 19 Family of Systems, and MMS) also increased inventory objectives. This training is required based on execution of acquisition programs, ECPs and product improvements.

Remarks.val: [Hardware/Recurring] ExMCM Outfitting: This funding resources the procurement of Expeditionary UUV-based systems and support equipment.  Procurement of this equipment will allow the UUV-based systems to be deployed globally and employed from a wide variety of shipboard platforms at sea as well as small craft.  ExMCM cost elements include MK 18 MOD 1 and Mod 2 UUVs which provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 vehicles, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet, Sixth Fleet, and Seventh Fleet areas of responsibility .Additional  ExMCM procurement cost elements include Open Water Transport Systems (OWTS), Shipboard Charging Containers (SCC), Auxiliary Equipment sets, Mission support Equipment, Maintenance Kits, and  Fleet Support Kits.   The various kits comprise the ancillary and support equipment necessary to outfit an  ExMCM Company with a complete set of Mk 18 UUV related equipment and are procured from a variety of OEMs and sources.

Name.@footnote: CE 1.1.1 Expeditionary MCM (ExMCM) MK 18 MOD 2 UUV: This funding resources the procurement of Expeditionary UUV-based systems and support equipment on the OPNAV approved Table of Allowance. Procurement of this equipment will allow the UUV-based systems to be deployed globally and employed from a wide variety of shipboard platforms at sea as well as small craft.

CE 1.1.2 MK18 MOD 1 UUV (0207404N): Provides for procurement of UUV MK18 Mod 1 and 2 vehicles which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet and Seventh Fleet areas of responsibility.

CE 1.1.3 MK18 MOD 1 UMCM UUV INCREMENTAL (CIP) RETROFIT KITS (0207404N): Unit cost of individual retrofit kits may vary based on the number and type of technologies included and systems bein upgraded and are identified as incremental Block Upgrades (e.g., current increment Block C retrofit kit is an upgrade in capability for the MK18 MOD 1 UUV System) these retrofit kits address more than one upgrade and address different functional area, i.e. enhanced navigation, system autonomy, improved post mission analysis, etc.  Accordingly the number of retrofit kits may number of systems/vehicles fielded.
Name.val: 1.1.3) MK18 MOD 1 UMCM UUV INCREMENTAL (CIP) Retrofit Kit (0207404N)

Name.@footnote: CE 1.1.4 MK18 MOD 2 RTROFIT KITS SYNTHETIC APERTURE SONAR (SSAM) (0207404N): Provides for procurement of UUV MK18 MOD 2 retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational mission in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet and Seventh Fleet area of responsibility.  these retrofit kits add advanced capability to the MK18 Mod 2 system.  Unit costs of the advanced sensor retrofit kits can vary based on the number and type of sensor upgrades.

CE 1.1.5 MK 18 Mod 2 Retrofit Kits (ATLAS forward look sonar) (0207404N): Provides for procurement of UUV MK 18 Mod 2 retrofit kits, which will be employed in operational missions in Shallow Water (SW) and Very Shallow Water (VSW) environments including rotational deployments to the Fifth Fleet and Seventh Fleet area of responsibility. These retrofit kits add advanced capability to the MK 18 Mod 2 system. Unit costs of the advanced sensor retrofit kits can vary based on the number and type of sensor upgrades.

CE 1.1.6 ExMCM Auxiliary, Support, Maintenance, and Mission Support Equipment Kits: The ExMCM Aux Kits includes equipment required for ExMCM deployment, pre-mission planning and post mission analysis. In addition, new procurement auxiliary kits will need to be procured to support enhancements to legacy fleet systems through engineering changes, system upgrades and obsolescence of legacy auxiliary kits. Items include those required to deploy the ExMCM equipment such as transport carts, transport cases, test equipment, pre-mission planning equipment not covered in the support or maintenance kits The ExMCM Support Kit comprises GETACs, PMA stations, cross-domain modules, and other support items that comprise a portion of the ExMCM system outfitting. The Maintenance Kit comprises special tool kits, calibration equipment, fly away maintenance modules, and other maintenance items. Unit cost of individual kits may vary based on number and type of technology included in each kit.

CE 1.1.7 ExMCM Diver Sensor/Navigation Systems: Provides for the procurement of the next generation of integrated ExMCM diver-based acoustic sensor precise navigation system to perform re-acquisition,  inspection and identification of underwater threat objects to include limpet mines, underwater UXO, and underwater IEDs.

CE 1.1.8 ExMCM EOD Response ROVs: Procurement of EOD Response vehicles and associated sub-systems to leverage advancements in robotic manipulators, target recognition software, user interface, and explosive recognition and neutralization that have been achieved in land robots and which can now be integrated into undersea remotely operated vehicles. These EOD response systems will enable more rapid reacquisition, identification and neutralization of mine like targets found by other search assets.
Name.val: 1.1.8) ExMCM EOD Response Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV)

Name.@footnote: CE 1.1.9 ExMCM TOA Equipment: Procurement of EXMCM Company Table of Allowance (TOA) equipment for the sixteen EXMCM companies supporting USFIFTHFLT and USSEVENTHFLET Expeditionary MCM operations.
CE 1.1.10 ExMCM OWTS/SCC: Supports initial fielding of hardware of the Open Water Transport equipment and shipboard charging containers. Anticipated delivery schedule 2 per month.
Name.val: 1.1.10) ExMCM Open Water Transport Sys/Shipboard Charging Container OWTS/SCC

Name.@footnote: CE 1.1.11 ExMCM Procurement (C6F): Funding will procure critical ExMCM equipment needed to outfit deploying CTF 68 forces in support of ongoing USN operations in USSIXTHFLT AoR.

CE 1.1.12 ExMCM Diver Equipment: Funding for procurement of Underwater Breathing Apparatus (UBA) and associated diver support equipment in support of EXMCM Dive Platoons, EOD and Expeditionary Salvage Divers and.

Remarks.val: [Hardware/Recurring] MK 18 UUV outfitting in support of Naval Special Operation Forces.

Name.@footnote: CE:1.1.1 MK18 MOD1 UUV: Baseline and OCO funding provides for the replacement procurement of (4) MK18 MOD1 UUV in support of contingency Naval Special Warfare missions. The MK18 UUV systems have been identified as a Navy service-common systems and beginning in FY18 are funded using Department of the Navy resources. Previous MK18 UUV systems were procured by Special Operations Command (SOCOM) funding.
